title: Injury while snowboarding
description: Lack of powder snow and frozen slopes ended with me having an injured knee.
someText: In April and May, while studying JS, I took breaks to stay focused, opting for shorter, high-quality study sessions. Being a bit restless, I used these breaks to build a camper in my van.
someText2: June is my favorite time. As my knee improved, so did the weather. I decided to travel and journeyed from Stockholm to Barcelona and back with my campervan, an incredibly interesting and unforgettable experience that I believe everyone should try. I explored 12 countries on this trip, covering 8300km with no plan, just like a bird. After a month, I returned to my coding and continued developing.

title: First Steps
description: Dealing with a knee injury and the subsequent actions I took since January.
courseDesc: The course is in my native language, Georgian, and the lecturer is fantastic. She explains things in a clear way, which is crucial, especially when you're just starting and have no prior knowledge of programming. The course provides 23.5 hours of content. You can access the course on YouTube through the link below..
detDescription: After one month of studying and practicing smaller projects, I tried to create a slightly more complex web page design to ensure I knew styling well. I made an exact copy of the first page of www.sketch.com.

title: Practice
description: HTML, CSS, SASS, and some JS.
courseDesc: The course is in my native language, Georgian, and the lecturer is fantastic. She explains things in a clear way, which is crucial, especially when you're just starting and have no prior knowledge of programming. The course provides 23.5 hours of content. You can access the course on YouTube through the link below..
detDescription: It's worth seeing how I created dynamic components (footer and header) using vanilla JS before I even heard about React and how it works. My love for food has inspired me to consider starting my own restaurant in the future. Therefore, I decided to improve my skills by practicing on a restaurant web page.

title: JavaScript
courseDesc: After watching numerous YouTube videos, I realized I couldn't learn effectively from others' mistakes alone. Therefore, I enrolled in a course where the instructor explained JavaScript in the simplest way possible. I dedicated myself to practice and understanding. It was the most challenging period in my web development journey, but I persevered. Now, I have a solid understanding of JavaScript.
detDescription: During that time, I found a cool project: a to-do list. It matched my skill level, and I spent a lot of time practicing with JavaScript from morning to evening, trying different features.

title: Euro Trip
description: At some point, I realized I needed a break.
someText: In April and May, while studying JS, I took breaks to stay focused, opting for shorter, high-quality study sessions. Being a bit restless, I used these breaks to build a camper in my van.
someText2: June is my favorite time. As my knee improved, so did the weather. I decided to travel and journeyed from Stockholm to Barcelona and back with my campervan, an incredibly interesting and unforgettable experience that I believe everyone should try. I explored 12 countries on this trip, covering 8300km with no plan, just like a bird. After a month, I returned to my coding and continued developing.

title: Time for React
description: Got a suggestion to switch from vanilla JS to React and really liked that advice.
courseDesc: After JS course on Udemy, I enrolled in a React course. I've started learning React, and I just love how it works, how it organizes everything and simplifies the process. So far, I'm enjoying it.
detDescription: Firstly, I must say I loved React, especially after learning JS. I worked on several projects using React, and one of them showcases fetching data for delicious recipes and dynamic routes.

title: Restaurant Project in React
description: Fetching data and creating a checkout section using useContext.
courseDesc: After JS course on Udemy, I enrolled in a React course. I've started learning React, and I just love how it works, how it organizes everything and simplifies the process. So far, I'm enjoying it.
detDescription: Since I started learning JS, I've wanted to add items to the checkout section. Eventually, I used the same design for the webpage to save time because designing takes the most time, especially when I don't have anything prepared. In that project, you can find data fetching, useContext, and some other functionalities.

title: Now, Let's Get Serious
description: Like every photographer, I need my own webpage too.
detDescription: This is my current photography webpage: www.ArtofLevnidze.com. For this project, I used React. Take a look at how I efficiently filter data based on categories and applied Framer Motion for smooth card animations. While I'm not entirely satisfied with how I organized my styles in September, the upcoming project serves as a great example of well-managed styling.
someText: I've been into photography since 2012, and throughout this time, I've wanted to have my own webpage where I can change things according to my vision. I tried different platforms, but they didn't give me what I wanted. So, I always had this desire to learn web development, even though I initially thought coding was boring. Turns out, I was mistaken!

title: NextJs
description: Looking Ahead to a Career in Web Development
courseDesc: Having a positive experience with Udemy made me appreciate the platform. Considering its power and popularity, I decided to explore Next.js. I enrolled in a Next.js course with the intention of building my own portfolio.
detDescription: Moving from native React to Next.js was a smooth transition. I appreciated the simplicity of file-based and dynamic routing compared to native React. The most interesting part of the project is the ''Projects'2' section, where I aimed to implement dynamic routing with updatable information through a JSON file. I also focused on improving the organization of my styling compared to previous projects. It's worth mentioning that my solid knowledge of Photoshop and AI significantly contributed to creating a cartoonized version of my pictures, making my portfolio design better.
